intro: Geanthus lepicarpus, commonly known as the smooth-seeded geanthus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. Its fruit is a capsule that remains closed until maturity, releasing small, wind-dispersed seeds. This species is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and stream banks.
